DOC.brief_summary: The purpose trial investigate potential benefits/risks regard pretreatment prasugrel non-ST-elevation myocardial infarction ( NSTEMI ) participant elevate troponin schedule coronary angiography/percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) .
DOC.brief_title: A Comparison Prasugrel PCI Time Diagnosis Non-ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction
DOC.detailed_description: This trial consist two arm . One arm non pre-treatment arm . Participants arm receive placebo immediately NSTEMI diagnosis prior diagnostic coronary angiography . A 60 mg prasugrel load dose give immediately coronary angiography proceed PCI . Subsequently , participant receive daily maintenance dos prasugrel day 30 . Participants great equal 75 year age body weight less 60 kilogram ( kg ) receive 5 mg oral dose daily . All others receive 10 mg oral daily maintenance dose 30 day . The arm pre-treatment arm participant receive split load dose regimen 30 mg prasugrel administer immediately NSTEMI diagnosis prior diagnostic coronary angiography . The remainder load dose ( 30 mg ) administer participant proceed PCI . Subsequently , participant receive daily maintenance dos prasugrel day 30 . Participants great equal 75 year age body weight less 60 kg receive 5 mg oral dose daily . All others receive 10 mg oral daily maintenance dose 30 day .
DOC.criteria: Have acute coronary syndrome consist nonSTsegment elevation elevate troponin Scheduled coronary angiography/PCI great equal 2 less 24 hour time plan randomization , 48 hour randomization Must eligible treatment prasugrel , aspirin ( ASA ) , glycoprotein IIb/IIIa receptor ( GPIIb/IIIa ) inhibitor per respective label May maintenance dose clopidogrel 75 mg must able switch prasugrel Must enrol cardiac catheterization laboratory hospital hospital/ambulance service affiliate cardiac catheterization laboratory hospital Present STsegment elevation myocardial infarction ( STEMI ) time entry randomization Have cardiogenic shock Have refractory ventricular arrhythmia Have New York Heart Association ( NYHA ) Class IV congestive heart failure ( CHF ) Have cardiac arrest within 1 week entry randomization study
